WifiScan.title: Wifi

viewBlocks.title: Places visited
viewBlocks.text: This map shows what places Google think you visited with the size corresponding to the time you spent in this place:

viewBlocks.sql: SELECT winnerLatitude, winnerLongitude, winnerAddress, winnerName, winnerConfidence, winnerSemanticType, loserLatitude, loserLongitude, loserAddress, loserName, loserConfidence, loserSemanticType, startTimestamp, endTimestamp FROM Winners INNER JOIN Losers ON Winners.id = Losers.loserId
viewBlocks.title: One Place

viewBlocks.sql: SELECT winnerLatitude, winnerLongitude, winnerAddress, winnerName, winnerConfidence, winnerSemanticType, loserLatitude, loserLongitude, loserAddress, loserName, loserConfidence, loserSemanticType, startTimestamp, endTimestamp FROM Winners INNER JOIN Losers ON Winners.id = Losers.loserId
viewBlocks.title: Other Candidates
viewBlocks.text: This map shows the other candidate places proposed by Google linked to the location that Google think you visited:

viewBlocks.title: Travels
viewBlocks.text: This map shows what trips Google think you did:

viewBlocks.sql: WITH a AS ( SELECT * FROM Records ORDER BY Records.timestamp DESC LIMIT 100000 ) SELECT a.latitude, a.longitude, a.timestamp, a.accuracy, a.source, ActivitySegment.activityType FROM a, ActivitySegment WHERE a.timestamp >= startTimestamp AND a.timestamp <= endTimestamp
viewBlocks.title: Records
viewBlocks.text: This map shows records associated to a trip with the color corresponding to an activity type:

viewBlocks.sql: SELECT mac, AVG(latitude) AS latitude, AVG(longitude) AS longitude, COUNT(*) AS number_of_detections FROM WifiScan INNER JOIN MacAdresses ON WifiScan.id = MacAdresses.macId GROUP BY mac ORDER BY COUNT() DESC
viewBlocks.title: Wifi
viewBlocks.text: This map shows where your phone detected mac addresses with the size corresponding to the number of times it was detected:
